name: Pygmalion's Spectacles
description: In 1935 Stanley G Weinbaum fictional story Pygmalion Spectcles intorduced readers to the ideia that a device can allow you to escape reality into a simulated enviroment.

name: Sensorama
description: In 1957 Morton Heilig invents the sensorama, a seated viewfinder experience that allowed you to be in the film by blocking outside visuals, emitting smells, fans to add the sense of touch and a vibrating chair for a haptic feedback.

name: Headsight - First HMD
description: In Philco Corporation created the Headsight, for the first time displays were mounted to a wearable device. Created for the military so soldiers could remote view experiences of hazardous materials.
